com.github.uberroot.ncjbot

Class RemoteNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.uberroot.ncjbot.RemoteNode

  • public final class RemoteNode
extends java.lang.Object

    This class is responsible for holding data about remote nodes and handling the underlying socket communication.

    Author:
    Carter Waxman

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  RemoteNode.EventListener
      An interface to receive events that occur with a remote node.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RemoteNode

        public RemoteNode(LocalNode node,
          java.lang.String ip,
          int port)
           throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        Creates an instance of a RemoteNode with the host/port pair.
        Parameters:
        node - The running LocalNode instance.
        ip - IPv4 address or hostname of the machine running the node.
        port - TCP Port on which the node listens.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException

      • getNodeState

        public NodeState getNodeState()
        Gets the last confirmed state of the RemoteNode. This state is queried only when an operation is performed on the node.
        Returns:
        the last confirmed state of the RemoteNode.

      • getKnownNodes

        public java.util.List<RemoteNode> getKnownNodes()
                                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                                NodeStateException
        Queries the node for a list of all other nodes it communicates with.

      • sendData

        public void sendData(java.lang.String destTid,
            byte[] data)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     NodeStateException
        Sends a unit of data to a specific job on the remote node.
        Parameters:
        destTid - The thread id of the job receiving the data.
        data - The data to send.
        Throws:
        java.net.ConnectException
        java.io.IOException
        NodeStateException

      • sendJob

        public long sendJob(long ownerTid,
           java.io.File worker,
           byte[] params)
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    NodeStateException
        Sends a job to be run on the RemoteNode. This will automatically register the RemoteNode with the Watchdog. Upon completion, a corresponding call to releaseWatchdogReceiver() should occur with this node.
        Parameters:
        ownerTid - The thread id of the job that will be the parent of the started job.
        worker - A file pointing to the class file to send.
        params - Initialization parameters for the new LocalJob.
        Returns:
        The remote thread id of the new job.
        Throws:
        java.net.ConnectException
        java.io.IOException
        NodeStateException

      • beacon

        public void beacon()
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   NodeStateException

        Alerts the RemoteNode to the presence of this node. This is used to join into a network and to alert the RemoteNode that the current node is still active.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        NodeStateException

      • addEventListener

        public void addEventListener(RemoteNode.EventListener listener)

        Registers a RemoteNode.EventListener for this RemoteNode.

        Parameters:
        listener - The RemoteNode.EventListener to add.

      • removeEventListener

        public boolean removeEventListener(RemoteNode.EventListener listener)

        Removes a RemoteNode.EventListener from this RemoteNode.

        Parameters:
        listener - The RemoteNode.EventListener to remove.
        Returns:
        True if the listener was operating on this RemoteNode.

      • setState

        private void setState(NodeState state)

        Sets the new state for the RemoteNode and notifies listeners if the new state is different from the current state.

        Parameters:
        state - The new node state.

      • nodeStateChanged

        private void nodeStateChanged()

        Notifies all event listeners for this RemoteNode of a state change event. All of the listeners that were registered when the method was first invoked will be notified, even if removed from a callback. Likewise, new listeners will not receive the current event if it is added during the event callback. The new collection of EventListeners will take effect upon completion of this method.

      • nodeConnectionFailed

        private void nodeConnectionFailed()

        Notifies all event listeners of a connection failure with this RemoteNode. All of the listeners that were registered when the method was first invoked will be notified, even if removed from a callback. Likewise, new listeners will not receive the current event if it is added during the event callback. The new collection of EventListeners will take effect upon completion of this method.
